txt: 上海艾通大学
学术报告
系列
Title:OnComputationalShortcutsforInformation-theoreticPiR
洪文浩
Speaker: Matthew M.Hong
Venue:SEIEE3-414
Time:3pm,November4,2020
Abstract:
Informationtheoretic private information retrieval (PiR) schemes have at-
tractive concrete efficiency features. However, in the standard PiR model, the
computational complexity of the servers must scale linearly with the database
size
We study the possibility of bypassing this limitation in the case where the da-
tabase is a truth table of a "simple" function, such as a union of (multi-dimen-
sional) intervals or convex shapes, a decision tree, or a DNF formula. This ques-
tion is motivated by the goal of obtaining lightweight homomorphic secret sharing
(HSS)schemesandsecuremultipartycomputation (MPC)protocolsforthecor-
responding families.We obtain both positive and negative results. For"first-gen-
eration"PiR schemes based on Reed-Muller codes, we obtain computational
shortcuts for the above function families, with the exception of DNF formulas for
which we show a (conditional) hardness result.For ""third-generation"PiR
schemes based on matching vectors, we obtain stronger hardness results that
apply to all of the above families
Our positive results yield new informationtheoretic HSS schemes and MPC
protocols with attractive efficiency features for simple but useful function families.
Our negative results establish new connections between information-theoretic
cryptography and fine-grained complexity.This is joint work with Yuval Ishai,
Victor I. Kolobov and Russell W. F. Lai. Work done in part visiting Technion.
Bio
MatthewM.Hong(洪文浩)is a researchassistantatShanghaiQiZhiInsti-
tute working under the supervision of Professor Yu Yu (SJTU). He obtained his
B.Eng. in Computer Science (Yao Class) from Tsinghua University in 2020. His
research interests include cryptography and theoretical computer science in gen-
eral.
